name: hivelocity
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing hivelocity cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`hivelocity` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/hivelocity/terraform-provider-hivelocity).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing hivelocity cloud resources.. Based on terraform-provider-hivelocity: version vv0.7.9
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/hivelocity/terraform-provider-hivelocity)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-hivelocity` repo](https://github.com/embp/pulumi-hivelocity/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-hivelocity` repo](https://github.com/hivelocity/terraform-provider-hivelocity/issues).

python.readme:

> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-hivelocity` repo](https://github.com/embp/pulumi-hivelocity/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-hivelocity` repo](https://github.com/hivelocity/terraform-provider-hivelocity/issues).

apiKey.description: Your API Key from the https://my.hivelocity.net portal.

apiUrl.description: The API instance to communicate with defaults to https://core.hivelocity.net/api/v2

bonded.description: When set, prefer only bonded devices

forceDeviceId.description: Force deployment of this Device ID (internal use only)

lastUpdated.description: Last time this device was updated

osName.description: Operating system to install on device

productId.description: Product ID to pick from the stock

publicSshKeyId.description: ID of a SSH Key to apply for device

vlanId.deprecationMessage: This field is deprecated. Please use a hivelocity.Vlan resource instead.

provider.description:
The provider type for the hivelocity package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.
